titleStmt.title: J. R. Askin et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5587

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bracken Criminal Ct
vs
W D. Ratcliffe

To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Bracken County, represent to yr Excellency that at the recent Term of the Bracken Circuit ^Criminal^ Court, W. D. Ratcliffe, was indicted by the Grand Jury for said County, for the Crime of murder, committed by killing James M. Cullen.

We understand that a petition is in Circulation (under the auspices of the Counsel & friends of the prisoner, men of influence in the County) for signatures, praying yr Excellency to pardon the accused.

We the undersigned impartial citizens of said County, beg leave most respectfuly but most earnestly to remonstrate, against the exercise of Executive Clemency, in the present case, in advance of V an a judicial investigation, & the action of a jury of the Country upon the Case. We will not anticipate this inquiry & action of the Court & jury; it is certain to be discreet & impartial, but we beg leave to assure yr Excellency, that to interfere in this case, in advance, would shock the public sensibility, & serious impair the confidence ^respect^ of the people of Bracken for the great & wise power of pardon, vested in the Chief magistrate of the Commonwealth We are most respectfully, & dutifully

Yr Excellencys obedient servants &c
J. R. Askin
C T Helvy
Charles Gusnegen
Hugh Kennedy
L N Gallaspy
H Bebley
Evan.T. Howard
Wm Hitt
